Already have an account? Sign in

The bench press is a compound exercise that targets your chest, front deltoids, and triceps. Lie on a flat bench, grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder width, lower it to your chest with control, then press it back up.

Similar to the bench press but performed on an incline bench with dumbbells. This variation targets the upper chest more effectively. Keep your core tight and maintain control throughout the movement.
A chest isolation exercise. Lie on a flat bench with dumbbells, start with arms extended above chest, then lower them out to sides in a wide arc motion while maintaining a slight bend in elbows.

A bodyweight compound exercise targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps. Start in plank position, lower your body until chest nearly touches the ground while keeping your body straight, then push back up.
An isolation exercise for chest definition. Stand between cable machines, pull cables forward and down in an arc motion, focusing on squeezing your chest at the point of maximum contraction.

A compound upper body exercise. Hang from a bar with palms facing away, pull yourself up until chin is over the bar while keeping core tight. Focus on using your back muscles to initiate the movement.
A compound back exercise. Bend over with a barbell, keeping your back straight, pull the weight to your lower chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower with control.
A machine-based back exercise. Sit at a lat pulldown machine, grab the bar with a wide grip, and pull it down to your upper chest while keeping your torso upright. Focus on using your lats.
A compound back exercise. Sit at a rowing machine with feet secured, pull the handle to your lower chest while keeping your back straight and chest up. Squeeze your shoulder blades together.
A rear deltoid and upper back exercise. Using a rope attachment on a high pulley, pull towards your face while keeping elbows high and squeezing shoulder blades together.
A compound shoulder exercise. Stand with barbell at shoulders, press it overhead until arms are fully extended. Keep core tight and avoid excessive back arch.
An isolation exercise for side deltoids. Stand with dumbbells at sides, raise them out to shoulder level with slight bend in elbows. Control the movement and avoid swinging.
An isolation exercise for front deltoids. Stand with dumbbells in front of thighs, raise them to shoulder level while keeping arms relatively straight. Maintain controlled movement.
Targets rear deltoids. Bend forward with dumbbells hanging down, raise them out to sides while keeping slight bend in elbows. Focus on squeezing shoulder blades together.
An isolation exercise for trapezius muscles. Stand holding dumbbells at sides, elevate shoulders straight up toward ears. Hold the contraction briefly at the top.
A compound bicep exercise. Stand with barbell at thighs, curl it up to shoulders while keeping upper arms still. Focus on full range of motion and controlled movement.
A bicep variation that also targets forearms. Stand with dumbbells at sides, curl them up while keeping palms facing each other. Maintain controlled movement throughout.
A bicep isolation exercise. Sit on an incline bench, let arms hang straight down, curl dumbbells up while keeping upper arms still. This variation increases stretch on the biceps.
An isolation exercise for biceps. Sit at preacher bench, rest arms on pad, curl weight up while keeping upper arms in contact with pad. Focuses on peak contraction.
A focused bicep exercise. Sit on bench, rest elbow on inner thigh, curl dumbbell up while keeping upper arm still. Excellent for developing peak and control.
An isolation exercise for triceps. Stand at cable machine, push rope or bar down until arms are fully extended. Keep elbows close to body throughout movement.
A tricep isolation exercise. Lie on bench, hold weight above forehead, lower it behind head by bending elbows, then extend arms back up. Keep upper arms still.
A tricep isolation movement. Hold weight behind head with both hands, extend arms overhead while keeping upper arms still. Focus on full extension.
A bodyweight tricep exercise. Perform pushup with hands close together forming diamond shape. Keep elbows close to body throughout movement.
A compound tricep exercise. Support body on parallel bars, lower yourself by bending elbows, then push back up to starting position. Keep torso upright for tricep focus.
A fundamental leg compound exercise. Stand with barbell on upper back, bend knees and hips to lower body until thighs are parallel to ground, then drive back up.
A full-body compound movement. Stand with barbell at shins, grip bar and lift by extending hips and knees while keeping back straight. Focus on proper form.
A compound leg exercise. Sit in leg press machine, push weight away by extending knees and hips. Keep lower back pressed against seat throughout movement.
A unilateral leg exercise. Step forward into lunge position, lower back knee toward ground, then push back up. Maintain upright posture throughout.
An isolation exercise for calves. Stand on edge of platform, lower heels below platform level, then raise up onto toes. Focus on full range of motion.
A basic ab exercise. Lie on back, hands behind head, curl upper body up toward knees while keeping lower back pressed to ground. Focus on controlled movement.
A core stability exercise. Hold push-up position with forearms on ground, maintain straight body position from head to heels. Focus on keeping core tight.
A lower ab exercise. Lie on back, keep legs straight, raise them up until perpendicular to ground, then lower with control. Keep lower back pressed down.
A rotational core exercise. Sit with knees bent and feet off ground, hold weight at chest, rotate torso side to side. Keep chest up throughout.
A dynamic core exercise. Start in plank position, alternately drive knees toward chest in running motion. Maintain plank position throughout.
